COLIN CLOUTES MOURNFULL DITTIE FOR THE DEATH OF ASTROPHELL.

Sheepheards that wont on pipes of Oaten reede,</br>Oft-times to plaine your loves concealed smart;</br>And with your pitteous Layes have learn'd to breede</br>Compassion in a Country-Lasses hart:</br>Hearken ye gentle Sheepheards to my song,</br>And place my dolefull plaint your plaints among.

To you alone I sing this mournfull verse,</br>The mournfull verse that everman heard tell:</br>To you whose softned harts it may emperse</br>With dolours dart for death of Astrophell.</br>To you I sing, and to none other wight:</br>For well I wot, my rimes been rudely dight.

Yet as they been, if any nicer wit</br>Shall hap to heare, or covet them to reade:</br>Thinke he, that such are for such ones most fit,</br>Made not to please the living, but the dead.</br>And if in him found pitty ever place;</br>Let him be moov'd to pitty such a case.</br>Edm. Spencer.</br>
